intro: Rogeria adenophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf rogeria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, daisy-like flowers. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens or as a decorative plant in arid landscapes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it well-suited for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value lies in its striking foliage and long-lasting blooms.
